result.execSummary:
The defendant Dale John Gerke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge within the term of probation. Defendant to pay costs of supervision.
Defendant to complete counseling started at Psychiatric Associates.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant shall not possess any firearms.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.  Defendant shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as recommended by Agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dale John Gerke

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dale John Gerke in court with attorney William Henry Gergen.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. will plead today to Count 2; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Court reviews recomm.; Court reviews charge/penalties; Def. pleads NC to Count 2 Poss. Firearm While Intox.; Court finds plea made FV&I and finds Def. guilty of Count 2 w/Counts 1 and 3 D&RI; State heard; Atty. Gergen heard; Court imposes sentence; Def. to report to P&P by 4pm on Wednesday

**W/H - 1 year PO
- $243 CC
- $200 DNA surcharge
- AODA & FT
- complete counseling started at Psychiatric Assoc.
- absolute sobriety, no bars
- no firearms

Defendant shall not possess any firearms.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.

(12:48) Defendant Dale John Gerke in custody via video with attorney William Henry Gergen. Yolanda Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Atty. Gergen enters NG pleas; Court orders DN sampe; State heard on bond/conditions; RD 5/18/15 at 3:30pm & JT 6/9/15 at 8:30am in Br. 3; Court sets $1,000.00 PA Bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not possess any firearms.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.
